definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: The specific methods for calculating net selling amount and Royalty are detailed in Appendix3 to the Contract.
sentences.chinese: 淨銷售額和提成費的具體計算方法詳見本合同附件三。

sentences.english: Haley Starshine :What was I going to do, take a percentage of their dirt?
sentences.chinese: 我能怎麼着，從他們的土裏拿提成？

sentences.english: That part of the price of the product which reflects the running royalty.
sentences.chinese: 產品價格中反映提成費的部分。

sentences.english: The schools typically receive a percentage of the sales from these machines.
sentences.chinese: 學校一般都會從這些售貨機收出的食物中提成。

sentences.english: The high basic salary deducts a percentage high, a five dangerous gold, consummation training system.
sentences.chinese: 高底薪高提成，五險一金，完善的培訓體系。

sentences.english: Said on behalf of the owner can sell , but to charge 20% commission .
sentences.chinese: 店主表示可以代賣，但要收取20%提成。

sentences.english: He can _get a percentage__ for every car sold.
sentences.chinese: 每售出一輛車，他便得到一份提成。

sentences.english: We hope you can reduce to 1% of the sales price on royalty.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望你們把每件產品的提成費降到1%。

definition: brokerage/a commission paid to a middleman/euphemism for a bribe/a kickback
piece rate wage/remuneration based on one's output/opposite: time rate wage 計時工資|计时工资[ji4 shi2 gong1 zi1]
to give an extra subsidy, or bonus etc/bonus/perquisite
